class.name: jsx3.gui.List
class.text: The jsx3.gui.List class supports sorting, resizing, reordering, selection, discontinuous selection, key and mouse navigation, etc. Its data is accessed via the CDF interface.

param.name: strName
param.text: unique name distinguishing this object from all other JSX GUI objects in the JSX application

method.name: appendRow

param.name: objMasterRecord
param.text: JavaScript object containing at least the field jsxid.

param.name: strID
param.text: if provided this id will be used as the id (jsxid) for objMasterRecord. If null, a unique, system-generated key will be used.

method.text: Appends a new row to the end of the list and adds a corresponding record to the CDF source XML. This method requires that at least one CDF record already be present to use as a master to clone from if the objMasterRecord parameter is null.

method.name: clearXSL
method.text: List instances typically start with a baseline, system XSL file which is then extended at run-time to include the output markup specific to the child columns; calling this method will remove the document from the cache, effectively causing the template to reset; returns ref to self

method.name: deselectAllRecords
method.text: Deselects all selected CDF records of this list.

method.name: deselectRecord

param.name: strRecordId
param.text: the jsxid of the record to deselect.

method.text: Deselects a CDF record of this list. The item will be un-highlighted in the view and the CDF data will be updated accordingly.

method.name: deselectRecords
method.text: Deselects all selected records of this list. This method updates both the model and the view.

method.name: doClearSelections
method.text: Deselects all selected records of this list. This method updates both the model and the view.

method.name: doDeselect

param.name: strRecordId
param.text: 'jsxid' value for the record node (according to the CDF) to select in the DATA MODEL

param.name: bVIEW
param.text: true if null; if true, the selection state in the VIEW will be updated to reflect the selection within the MODEL

method.text: Deselects a given record for the list. Invokes the SELECT and CHANGE model events only under the deprecated 3.0 model event protocol.

method.name: doExecute

param.name: strRecordId
param.text: 'jsxid' value for the record node (according to the CDF) to execute

method.text: Executes any bound code for a record of this list specified by the strRecordId parameter. If this parameter is omitted the code of any currently selected records is executed. Invokes the EXECUTE model event only under the deprecated 3.0 model event protocol.

method.name: doSelect

param.name: strRecordId
param.text: 'jsxid' value for the record node (according to the CDF) to select in the DATA MODEL

param.name: bVIEW
param.text: true if null; if true, the selection state in the VIEW will be updated to reflect the selection within the MODEL

param.name: bNoEvent
param.text: if true, then don't invoke a selection event

method.text: Selects a given record for the list. Invokes the SELECT and CHANGE model events only under the deprecated 3.0 model event protocol.

method.name: doSort

param.name: intSortDir
param.text: SORTASCENDING or SORTDESCENDING.

method.text: Sorts this list according to the current sort path. If no sort direction is specified, the value will be toggled.

method.name: doValidate
method.text: validates the list; if the list is set to 'required', a selection must be made to pass validation. Otherwise, a list will always pass validation

method.name: executeRecord

param.name: strRecordId
param.text: the jsxid of the CDF record to execute.

method.text: Evaluates the JavaScript code in the jsxexecute attribute of one CDF record of this list.

method.name: focusRecord

param.name: strRecordId
param.text: the jsxid value for the record node (according to the CDF) to give focus to.

method.text: Gives cursor focus to a row in the list.

method.name: getActiveRow

return.text: the JavaScript DOM object or null if no row is active.

method.text: Returns a handle to the active TR for the list.

method.name: getAutoExpand
method.deprecated: Replaced by getGrowBy which returns an integer argument rather than a boolean.

method.name: getBackgroundColorHead
method.text: Returns the CSS color for the header row (for example, "#ffffff"). If this value is not set (null) the list will render with the default value of jsx3.gui.List.DEFAULTBACKGROUNDCOLORHEAD.

method.name: getBackgroundHead
method.text: Returns the CSS background property for the header row (for example, "background-image:url(abc.gif)"). If this value is not set (null) the list will render with the default value of jsx3.gui.List.DEFAULTBACKGROUNDHEAD.

method.name: getCanReorder
method.text: Returns whether the columns in the list can be re-ordered via user interaction. The default value is jsx3.Boolean.TRUE.

method.name: getCanSort
method.text: Returns whether the list will render with sortable columns.

method.name: getGrowBy
method.text: Returns whether or not a new row will be appended to the VIEW when a new record is added to the CDF document for the List. In the case of a grid, a new row is also appended when the last row in the grid gets cursor focus.

method.name: getHeaderHeight
method.text: Returns the height of the header row in pixels. If this value is not set (null) the list will render with the default value of jsx3.gui.List.DEFAULTHEADERHEIGHT.

method.name: getMultiSelect
method.text: Returns the selection type of this list.

method.name: getResizable
method.text: Returns whether columns in this list can be resized. The default value is jsx3.Boolean.TRUE.

method.name: getSelectedIds
method.text: Returns the ids of the selected records of this list.

method.name: getSelectedNodes
method.text: Returns the collection of selected records.

method.name: getSortColumn
method.text: Returns the zero-based index of column to sort on.

method.name: getSortDirection
method.text: Returns the direction (jsx3.gui.List.SORTASCENDING or jsx3.gui.List.SORTDESCENDING) for the sorted column; if no direction specified, ascending is returned

method.name: getSortPath
method.text: Returns the selection path for XSLT to use when sorting output. Typically this is simply the name of the attribute preceded by '@' (i.e., @jsxtext, @social, @phone, etc); if no value exists (e.g., null), an empty string is returned

method.name: getSortType
method.text: Returns the data type to be used for sorting this list. This value is either the one explicitly set with setSortType() or the data type of the current sort.

method.name: getValue
method.text: Returns the jsxid of the selected record if this list is a single-select list or an array of the the jsxids of the selected records if this list is a multi-select list.

method.name: getWrap
method.text: Returns whether or not the rows in the grid will support text-wrapping and expand to display their wrapped content OR be a fixed height. The default value is jsx3.Boolean.TRUE.

method.name: getXSL

return.text: jsx3.xml.Document instance containing valid XSL stylesheet

method.text: Returns xslt for the List, prioritizing the acquisition in the following order: 1) check cache; 2) check jsxxsl; 3) check jsxxslurl; 4) use default

method.name: isSelected

param.name: strRecordId
param.text: jsxid property for the record to check selection state for

method.text: Returns whether or not the given record is selected (true/false)

method.name: paint
method.text: Returns the DHTML, used for this object's on-screen VIEW

method.name: redrawRecord

param.name: strRecordId
param.text: jsxid value for the record node (according to the CDF) to redraw

param.name: intAction
param.text: jsx3.xml.CDF.INSERT, jsx3.xml.CDF.DELETE, or jsx3.xml.CDF.UPDATE.

method.text: List implementation.

method.name: repaintBody
method.text: Repaints the body portion of the list (the data rows), retaining the scroll position in the list whereas repainting the entire list would reset scroll position.

method.name: repaintHead
method.text:
Repaints the head portion of the list (the header row).
Note that this method will not change the rendered height of the header row. Therefore, after the header height is changed programmatically, repaint() must be called for the list to render properly.

method.name: revealRecord

param.name: strRecordId
param.text: the id of the record to reveal

param.name: objJSX
param.text: if provided, reveal the record up to this visual block; useful if the list is set to overflow:expand and the containing block is set to overflow:scroll

method.text: Reveals a record by scrolling any ancestor blocks as necessary.

method.name: selectRecord

param.name: strRecordId
param.text: the jsxid of the record to select.

method.text: Selects a CDF record of this list. The item will be highlighted in the view and the CDF data will be updated accordingly. If this list is a multi-select list then this selection will be added to any previous selection.

method.name: setAutoExpand

param.name: bExpand
param.text: jsx3.Boolean.TRUE or jsx3.Boolean.FALSE.

method.deprecated: Replaced by setGrowBy which takes an integer argument rather than a boolean one.

method.name: setBackgroundColorHead

param.name: strBGColor
param.text: CSS color property

method.text: Sets the CSS color for the header row (for example, #ffffff)

method.name: setBackgroundHead

param.name: strBG
param.text: CSS background property

method.text: Sets the CSS background property (can be a composite of varoius CSS-related bg properties)

method.name: setCanReorder

param.name: intReorder
param.text: one of: jsx3.Boolean.TRUE or jsx3.Boolean.FALSE

method.text: Sets whether the columns in the list can be re-ordered via user interaction with the VIEW

method.name: setCanSort

param.name: SORT
param.text: one of: jsx3.Boolean.TRUE or jsx3.Boolean.FALSE

method.text: Sets whether the list will render with sortable columns.

method.name: setGrowBy

param.name: intGrow
param.text: jsx3.Boolean.TRUE or jsx3.Boolean.FALSE

method.text: Sets whether or not a new row will be appended to the VIEW when a new record is added to the CDF document for the List. In the case of a grid, a new row is also appended when the last row in the grid gets cursor focus.

method.name: setHeaderHeight
method.text: Sets the height of the header row in pixels. Set to zero (0) to hide the header row and only render the body rows for the list.

method.name: setMultiSelect

param.name: intMulti
param.text: MULTI, SINGLE, or NOTSELECTABLE.

method.text: Sets the selection type of this list.

method.name: setResizable

param.name: BOOLEAN
param.text: jsx3.Boolean.TRUE or jsx3.Boolean.TRUE

method.text: Sets whether columns in this list can be resized.

method.name: setSortColumn

param.name: intColumnIndex
param.text: zero-based index of child column

method.text: Sets the zero-based index of column to sort on and executes the sort. This method fires the AFTER_SORT only under the deprecated 3.0 model event protocol.

method.name: setSortDirection

param.name: intSortDir
param.text: one of: jsx3.gui.List.SORTASCENDING or jsx3.gui.List.SORTDESCENDING

method.text: Sets the direction (ascending or descending) for the sorted column.

method.name: setSortPath

param.name: strPath
param.text: selection path (xpath / xsl query)

method.text: Sets the index for the column that the data will be sorted on; returns a ref to self;

method.name: setSortType

param.name: strDataType
param.text: jsx3.gui.Column.TYPETEXT or jsx3.gui.Column.TYPENUMBER

method.text: Sets the data type for the list. This explicit value will override any column data type if set. If it is not set the data type specific to the sort column is used for sorting.

method.name: setValue
method.text: Sets the selected records for this list. This method clears any current selection state and updates both the view and the model. The strRecordId parameter should be a single value for a single-select list or a list of values for a multi-select list.

method.name: setWrap

param.name: WRAP
param.text: jsx3.Boolean.TRUE or jsx3.Boolean.FALSE

method.text: Sets whether or not the rows in the grid will support text-wrapping and expand to display their wrapped content OR be a fixed height.

method.name: updateRow

param.name: strRecordId
param.text: id for the CDF record whose associated on-screen TR needs to be updated.

method.text: Updates the DHTML (VIEW) for an existing row within a list, circumventing a full table repaint by updating the row directly.

method.name: getVersion
method.text: Returns the release/build for the class (i.e., "2.2.00")

method.name: onCheck

param.name: strId
param.text: CDF record id (jsxid)

param.name: strPropName
param.text: CDF attribute name for attribute that stores the value of the checkbox

param.name: objGUI
param.text: browser checkbox element (what was checked)

param.name: bToggle
param.text: if true, the checkbox will be toggled via this function and the result will be persisted. if false, the current state of the checkbox will be persisted.

param.name: objArray
param.text: 2-element JavaScript array. First element contains the value to insert into the CDF for @strPropName if the checkbox is checked. Second element is for unchecked states.

method.text: provides function that can be called from XSLT-generated content in a list cell. Allows update of CDF via persistent mask interface (checkbox)

method.name: onDelete

param.name: strId
param.text: CDF record id (jsxid) for the row to delete.

param.name: objGUI
param.text: browser element (the hyperlink was clicked) that is contained in the list instance.

method.text: Static function that can be called from XSLT-generated content in a list cell to delete a row from the CDF of a list instance.

method.name: onRadio

param.name: strId
param.text: CDF record id (jsxid)

param.name: strPropName
param.text: CDF attribute name for attribute that stores the value of the radio button

param.name: objGUI
param.text: browser radio button element

param.name: bSelect
param.text: if true, the radio button will be forced to a 'selected' state and the result will be persisted. if false, the current state of the radio button will be persisted.

param.name: objArray
param.text: 2-element JavaScript array. First element contains the value to insert into the CDF for @strPropName if the checkbox is checked. Second element is for unchecked states.

method.text: provides function that can be called from XSLT-generated content in a list cell. Allows update of CDF via persistent mask interface (radio button); assumes that the nodes in the CDF document have jsxgroupname attributes to distinguish the radio groups
